Tomato.name: Tomato
Tomato.soil_preparation: Till the soil and add compost before planting.
Tomato.watering_frequency: Regular watering, keep soil moist but not waterlogged.
Tomato.fertilization_schedule: Fertilize every 2 weeks with a balanced fertilizer.
Tomato.pest_management: Use insecticidal soap for aphids and handpick tomato hornworms.
Tomato.harvesting_techniques: Harvest when tomatoes are firm and fully colored.

Corn.name: Corn
Corn.soil_preparation: Mix in aged manure or compost before planting.
Corn.watering_frequency: Moderate watering, keep soil moist especially during tasseling and ear development.
Corn.fertilization_schedule: Side-dress with nitrogen fertilizer when plants are 8 inches tall and again when tassels appear.
Corn.pest_management: Use Bacillus thuringiensis (Bt) for earworms and rotate crops to manage rootworms.
Corn.harvesting_techniques: Harvest when ears are full and kernels are milky when punctured.

Lettuce.name: Lettuce
Lettuce.harvest_time: Spring varieties: Early Summer; Fall varieties: Early Fall
Lettuce.soil_type: Well-drained, fertile soil with good organic matter content
Lettuce.soil_preparation: Ensure soil pH around 6.0-7.0; amend with compost or well-rotted manure before planting.
Lettuce.watering_frequency: Regular and consistent watering; lettuce prefers moist soil.
Lettuce.fertilization_schedule: Apply a balanced fertilizer at planting and again as plants reach halfway to mature size.
Lettuce.pest_management: Use insecticidal soap for aphids and slug baits for slugs; introduce natural predators for aphid control.
Lettuce.harvesting_techniques: Harvest outer leaves as needed once they reach a usable size, or cut the whole plant near the base for a full harvest.

Carrot.name: Carrot
Carrot.soil_type: Loose, well-drained soil free of rocks and heavy clay
Carrot.soil_preparation: Loosen soil to at least 12 inches deep and remove stones; add compost or aged manure for nutrients.
Carrot.watering_frequency: Regular watering to keep soil evenly moist, especially during germination and root development.
Carrot.fertilization_schedule: Avoid heavy fertilization; apply a light feeding of balanced fertilizer at planting time.
Carrot.pest_management: Use row covers to prevent carrot rust fly; practice crop rotation to deter nematodes; use insecticidal soap for aphids.
Carrot.harvesting_techniques: Harvest carrots when roots reach desired size, usually around 1 inch in diameter; gently loosen soil to lift roots without breaking.

Potato.name: Potato
Potato.soil_type: Loose, well-drained sandy loam with good organic matter content
Potato.soil_preparation: Loosen soil to at least 6-8 inches deep; incorporate compost or aged manure for nutrients.
Potato.watering_frequency: Regular watering to keep soil evenly moist, especially during tuber formation.
Potato.fertilization_schedule: Apply a balanced fertilizer at planting time and again when plants begin to flower.
Potato.pest_management: Handpick beetles; use fungicides preventatively for blight; practice crop rotation to reduce scab.
Potato.harvesting_techniques: Harvest new potatoes when plants flower; harvest main crop potatoes when plants begin to yellow and die back.

Strawberry.name: Strawberry
Strawberry.soil_type: Well-drained, slightly acidic soil rich in organic matter
Strawberry.soil_preparation: Add compost or aged manure to soil before planting; ensure good drainage to prevent root rot.
Strawberry.watering_frequency: Regular watering to keep soil evenly moist, especially during flowering and fruit development.
Strawberry.fertilization_schedule: Apply a balanced fertilizer at planting and again in early spring before growth resumes.
Strawberry.pest_management: Use insecticidal soap for aphids and spider mites; remove infected plant parts to control gray mold.
Strawberry.harvesting_techniques: Harvest ripe berries every 2-3 days; pick with the stem attached to prevent bruising; avoid washing until ready to eat.

Broccoli.name: Broccoli
Broccoli.harvest_time: Spring varieties: Late Spring to Early Summer; Fall varieties: Late Summer to Early Fall
Broccoli.soil_type: Rich, well-drained soil with plenty of organic matter
Broccoli.soil_preparation: Add well-aged compost or manure to soil before planting; ensure pH around 6.0-7.0.
Broccoli.watering_frequency: Consistent watering, especially during head formation; keep soil moist but not waterlogged.
Broccoli.fertilization_schedule: Apply nitrogen-rich fertilizer at planting and side-dress with compost during growth.
Broccoli.pest_management: Use floating row covers for cabbage worms; handpick aphids; practice crop rotation to prevent clubroot.
Broccoli.harvesting_techniques: Harvest main head when buds are tight and compact; side shoots can be harvested as they develop.

Cucumber.name: Cucumber
Cucumber.soil_type: Well-drained, fertile soil rich in organic matter
Cucumber.soil_preparation: Add compost or aged manure to soil before planting; ensure good drainage.
Cucumber.watering_frequency: Regular and consistent watering; cucumbers need plenty of moisture for good fruit development.
Cucumber.fertilization_schedule: Apply a balanced fertilizer at planting time and again when vines begin to run.
Cucumber.pest_management: Use row covers to protect against cucumber beetles; apply fungicides preventatively for mildews.
Cucumber.harvesting_techniques: Harvest when cucumbers are firm and bright in color; cut them from the vine using scissors or a knife.
